title: Classical Greece: Democracy and Philosophy

vocab.definition: Government by the people, especially rule of the majority
Independent political unit consisting of a city and surrounding territory
Love of wisdom; systematic study of fundamental questions
Teaching through questioning to stimulate critical thinking
Period of great cultural and intellectual achievement

teachingNotes: Emphasize Greek contributions to democracy and philosophy. Discuss the influence on modern government and thought.

sample.question: What is government by the people called?

truefalse.question: A city-state is an independent political unit with a city and surrounding territory. (True or False)
Democracy means government by the people. (True or False)
Philosophy means hatred of wisdom. (True or False)
The Socratic method uses questioning. (True or False)
A golden age is a period of decline. (True or False)
In democracy, the majority rules. (True or False)
City-states were dependent units. (True or False)
Philosophy studies fundamental questions. (True or False)
The Socratic method stimulates critical thinking. (True or False)
Greece had a golden age. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What is government by the people?
What is an independent political unit?
What is a period of great achievement?

fillintheblank.question: A _____-_____ is an independent political unit.
A _____ age is a period of great achievement.
City-states included a city and surrounding _____.
Greece had a _____ age of achievement.

shortanswer.question: What is democracy?
expectedAny: Government by the people especially rule of the majority

shortanswer.question: What is a city-state?
expectedAny: Independent political unit consisting of a city and surrounding territory

shortanswer.question: What is philosophy?
expectedAny: Love of wisdom and systematic study of fundamental questions

shortanswer.question: What is the Socratic method?
expectedAny: Teaching through questioning to stimulate critical thinking
Learning by asking and answering questions

shortanswer.question: What was the golden age?
expectedAny: Period of great cultural and intellectual achievement
Time of artistic and philosophical excellence

shortanswer.question: How did Greek democracy work?
expectedAny: Citizens voted and participated in government decisions

shortanswer.question: Why were city-states important?
expectedAny: They were independent self-governing political units

shortanswer.question: What did Greek philosophers study?
expectedAny: Fundamental questions about truth knowledge and existence
Basic questions of life and thought

shortanswer.question: Why use the Socratic method?
expectedAny: To encourage critical thinking through questioning
Develops deeper understanding by examining ideas

shortanswer.question: What was Greece's legacy?
expectedAny: Democracy and philosophy that influenced modern civilization
Foundation for Western government and thought
Models for political and intellectual systems
